subclassFeature.name: College of the Bae'Qeshel

entries.name: Telphraezzar
entries: Ask ten bards from any part of the realms where bardcraft came from, and you'll more than likely get 12 distinctly different answers. Some say that the various musical instruments and spells used by Bard's came from the different planes in ways not unlike the ways wizardly and divine magic made their way to Faerun in the early days of its existence. Regardless, Bardcraft has shown itself to be a way to access the vast arcane powers of The Weave through the power of song in a way that is distinctly different from arcane and diving schools of thought. In time, bardcraft eventually organized itself into the schools and colleges that are known throughout Faerun today. At least, on the surface of Faerun.

While it does not exactly mirror the world above it, Faerun's Underdark has its own peoples, cities and cultures that have their own take on arcane, divine, and yes, bardic magic based on the properties of the Underdark and the deities that its denizens worship. This includes the most notorious of Underdark residents, the drow, and the exceedingly rare form of bardcraft embedded in their own culture, that of the ancient drow sect, the Bae'qeshel Telphraezzar, The Whisperers Of The Dark Queen.

entries.name: A Brief History
entries: It is speculated that the Bae'qeshel Telphraezzar originated in the ancient Ilythiiri city of Atorrnash and that the archmage Ka'Narlist had sponsored the growth of (under the not so subtle influence of Lolth) these dark bards as a way to promote the worship of Lolth over Ghaunadaur in the ancient dark elf city. After the Fourth Crown War and the Ilythiiri were banished to the Underdark, forever being known as the dhaerow (traitors), only a small group of these dark minstrels remained as drow culture began to become more centered around the divine communion with Lolth that it is known for today.

entries.name: The Bae'Qeshel Today
entries: As the drow society matured and created academies for its wizards, swordsmen and clergy, the bae'qeshel remained a small secret sect of minstrels that kept their existence out of the public drow eye. As drow society became more matriarchal, study of the bae'qeshel lore became limited to females and even then, was passed down from one bae'qeshel in a house to another, only inducting one dark whisper into what had become a secret sisterhood once per generation.

While calling the ways of the Dark Minstrels a 'bardic college' may be a misnomer at this point, its practices are spreading and may result in a formal school or guild related to this style of bardcraft establishing itself in time.

entries.name: RESTRICTION:ELVISH SPEAKERS ONLY
entries: The Bae'Qeshel is a young baric college that still has strong ties to drow culture. As such, its songs have yet to be translated into the common tongue and can currently only be properly commanded in elvish. Your DM can lift this restriction to better suit your campaign. The restriction reflects the story of the Bae'Qeshel in the author's version of the Forgotten Realms, but it might not apply to your DM's setting or your DM's version of the Realms.
When you choose this college at 3rd level, you learn songs that are fueled by bardic inspiration dice.

subclassFeature.name: Bard Inspiration Dice
entries: You use your Bae'Qeshel songs at the cost of your Bardic Inspiration dice. An inspiration die is expended when you use it for a Bae'Qeshel song or for the use of your Bardic Inspiration ability. The number of Bardic Inspiration dice you get, their size, as well as when you replenish them follow the same rules for the Bard Class as mentioned in the Player's Handbook.

subclassFeature.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some of your songs require your target to make a saving throw to resist the song's effects. The saving throw DC your bard Spell save DC unless otherwise mentioned.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you join the College of The Bae'Qeshel at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Stealth and Deception skills, as well as martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Bae'Qeshel Songs
entries: You learn two songs of your choice, which are detailed under "Songs" below. Many songs enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one song per attack. The range of each song is 60 feet unless otherwise noted. You learn two additional songs of your choice at 6th and 10th level. Each time you learn new songs, you can also replace one song you know with a different one.
Songs are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: Bae'Qeshel Songs
entries: You learn two additional songs of your choice for a total of 4, which are detailed under "Songs" below. Many songs enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one song per attack. The range of each song is 60 feet unless otherwise noted. Each time you learn new songs, you can also replace one song you know with a different one.
Songs are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: Bae'Qeshel Songs
entries: You learn two additional songs of your choice for a total of 6, which are detailed under "Songs" below. Many songs enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one song per attack. The range of each song is 60 feet unless otherwise noted. Each time you learn new songs, you can also replace one song you know with a different one.
Songs are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: Siphon Of the Dark Whisper
entries: At level 14, you are able to draw on music in your soul to fuel your Bae'Qeshel magic at the expense of your vitality. When you have no more uses of your Bardic Inspiration ability, you may use an action to convert your hit dice into usage of you bardic inspiration ability subject to hit dice you have available. The maximum number of uses of bardic inspiration that you can regain this way is equal to your charisma modifier. You regain the use of this ability when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Aria Of Discordance
entries: You can spend an inspiration die and use your Action to show your command over music to sing the Aria of The Bae'qeshel, creating a cone of sonic force. Each creature in a 30-foot cone originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes the result of your inspiration die in thunder damage and is pushed 5 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 5 feet away from you by the spell's effect, and the spell emits a thunderous boom audible out to 150 feet.

{@b At Higher Levels.} Starting at 6th level, you may spend additional inspiration dice on this song. Each additional inspiration die grants thunder damage equal to the result of its roll and an additional 5 feet of push as part of the spell effect.

optionalfeature.name: Dark Minstrel's Lullaby
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can you use your bonus action to expend one inspiration die to attempt to inflict additional poison damage equal to the result of the inspirational die roll.

optionalfeature.name: Dark Minstrel's Lullaby
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can you use your bonus action to expend one inspiration die to attempt to inflict additional poison damage equal to the result of the inspirational die roll.

{@b At Higher Levels.} Starting at 6th level, you may spend additional inspiration dice on this song. Each additional inspiration die grants poison damage equal to the result of its roll. In addition, when two or more inspiration dice are used the target must make a constitution save against your Bardic Spell Save DC or be poisoned for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Trill
entries: When you hit a creature with a spell or weapon attack, you can expend one inspiration die to attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of your choice that it's holding. You add the inspiration die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.

optionalfeature.name: Hymn Of Intimidation
entries: When you hit a creature with a spell or weapon attack, you can spend your bonus action to expend one inspiration die to attempt to frighten the target. You add the inspiration die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lyric Of The Lingering Laggard
entries: When you hit a creature with a spell or weapon attack, you can spend your bonus action to spend one inspiration die to attempt to slow the creature's movement. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have its movement halved on the next move action it takes.

optionalfeature.name: Provoking Chorus
entries: You use your Action to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who hear you and expend one inspiration die. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding the inspiration die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Psalm Of The Silent Deceiver
entries: You use your bonus action to spend the one bardic inspiration die to grant yourself advantage on Stealth and Deception checks for 1 minute, adding the result of the bardic inspiration die roll to the higher {@dice 1d20} roll.

optionalfeature.name: Shielding Melody
entries: When you move, you can use your bonus action expend one inspiration die, rolling the die and adding the number rolled to your AC until you stop moving.

optionalfeature.name: Sonic Riposte
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one inspiration die to make a spell attack against the creature's AC. If you hit, you do thunder damage equal to the result of inspiration die roll plus your charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Song Of The Whimpering Strike
entries: You use your bonus action to spend the one bardic inspiration die to weaken your target's next successful melee attack. If the target does not make a successful wisdom saving throw, it rolls twice the damage dice on the next melee attack it hits on, but takes the lower result for each damage dice of the melee attack.

optionalfeature.name: Verse Of The Vigorous Champion
entries: On your turn, you can use a bonus action and expend one inspiration die to bolster the resolve of one of your companions. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can hear you. That creature gains temporary hit points equal to the inspiration die roll.
